document.docAuthor: Ježek, Jan, Wahab, Rodzay Abdul & Ševčík, Jan
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Sycorax (Diptera: Psychodidae: Sycoracinae) from the Oriental Region

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Sycorax (Diptera: Psychodidae: Sycoracinae) from the Oriental Region

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 21–29.
Sycorax tomkineana Ježek
sp. nov.
male. 21. Head, frontal view. 22. Facets schematic, frontal view, domelike structures omitted. 23. Maxilla and palpus maxillaris. 24. Terminal lobes of labium. 25. Pharynx, cibarium and mandibles, dorsal view. 26. Haltere, lateral view. 27. Epandrium and cerci, lateral view. 28. Aedeagus in detail, dorsal view. 29. Aedeagal complex, lateral view. [Scale: 21–23, 25–29 = 0.1 mm; 24 = 0.05 mm]

FIGURES 30–36.
Sycorax tomkineana Ježek
sp. nov.
male. 30. Basal antennomeres, some ascoids omitted. 31. Wing. 32. Epandrium and surstyli, dorsal view. 33. Gonocoxite and gonostyle, dorsal view. 34. Aedeagal complex, dorsal view. 35. Paramere, lateral view. 36. Dorsomedial process of parameres, dorsal view. [Scale: 31 = 0.5 mm; 30, 32–36 = 0.1 mm]

FIGURE 37. Specimens of
Sycorax konopiki
sp. nov.
(males) resting on the frog
Ansonia leptopus
(Photo: O. Konopik).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype [male, slide]: Brunei , Ulu Temburong National Park, Kuala Belalong Field Studies Centre, primary lowland rainforest,
February 2013
, Oliver Konopik leg., collected on frog
Ansonia leptopus
. Deposited in UBDC . Paratype [male, in a pinned microvial with glycerol, the specimen previously cleared in Proteinase K]: same data as holotype , deposited in NMPC .
Etymology. The new species name (adjective) is based on the surname of the first author’s daughter, Věra Tomková.

Type locality.
The same data as in the previous described species.

Biology. The two specimens of this new species of
Sycorax
were found in contact with the dorsal surface of the frog
Ansonia leptopus
(for the other details see above under
S. konopiki
).
